A History of Ideas and Achievements in Artificial Intelligence

The document discusses the development of artificial intelligence from 1969, including the first large conference devoted exclusively to AI, organized by Donald E. Walker and Alistair Holden. The conference, IJCAI, was sponsored by 16 technical societies and featured 63 papers presented by authors from 9 countries.

Key Concepts:

  • Development of AI
  • First IJCAI Conference
  • Technical Progress
  • Applications of Artificial Intelligence
  • Shift from Toy Problems to Real-World Applications
  • Specialization in Subdisciplines
Artificial Intelligence History Conferences Funding Machine Learning Natural Language Processing
